Wow, so after a week and a half of playing like mad crazy, moving in, and having the first week of classes... well its been quite crazy.  

It was cool having my car during band camp.  I've really gotten to know the whole Atl area quite well.  Also since I got to drive around to the home area a bunch in search of djun djuns, and that was pretty fun.  For anyone who hasn't heard yet, we're playing the BD 99 show at Tech... which we all know is a kick ass show.  Its also great because it means I actually get to play hard stuff again.  When I went back to Quest last year, my hands were quite out of shape, but band camp even gave me all kinds of blisters on me hands.  I'm definately gonna be back up to speed for AQ.  *grins*

Moving in worked out really well.  We bought a carpet.  Its so pretty, and soft... Everyone come touch my carpet!!  Right now!!!!  Seriously, I've had people come up to my room just so they can walk on my carpet.  Come visit me!!

So after that great first week, classes started.  My mwf's are insane... 10-6 with a one hour break at 11.  I'd go get lunch then, but my 10 and 12 oclock classes are in the same building, so I pretty much just grab a snack... TR's are easy though *grin*  Monday after band, we definately went to the pool in the CRC... The waterslide is awesome!!  Seriously, whoulda thought it was gonna be like that?!?!  Definately went back again on Wednesday and today... 

Late late wednesday night... like 1 15 am... stopper in the toilet broke and we had some floodage... it was quite frustrating... my poor carpet was injureded... but it got steam cleaned and is all nice again *yay*

Highlight of everything though was the weekend.  Thursday late afternoonish Courtney came and spent the night with me.  We had so much fun!  Her, Sharma, Blake and I went to Felini's for dinner, and then to Sharmas room for a couple hours of Family Guy :o)  (course most of you already know all this... but ha! you get to read it again).  Then Courtney and I stayed up really late talking as usual.  Friday she was gonna drop me off at my house so I could get my car and get back in time for diff eqs... however I couldn't get into the house.  So Courtney and I had lunch at Arby's while my daddy drove home from work to the rescue... Ended up only getting back intime for politics... oh well.  Ooo!  My politics professor reminds me of Fezzini.  I'm just waiting for him to shout 'Inconceivable!"  :op .

So after band, Blake and I met up with Courtney and her then 'date' Steve at Olive Garden for dinner.  yum!  Steve is great!  He and I were definately talking a bunch, and theres nothing more awkward than not knowing what to say to one of your best friend's guys.  So then we all went to the NC-Kell game.  It was fun seeing everyone.  During Kell's halftime show I saw Chris (Rach's bro) and was very amused.  Started raining half way through NC.  So after running out of the rain and catching up with a bunch of people, Courtney, Blake, Steve and I went to C^2's house.  Holy Crap!!  It was sooo much fun.  Lots and lots of foosball, some rumikubness, and of course spades... followed by more foosball.  We were all in tears laughing quite often.  Not only do I get along with Steve, but Blake and Steve were getting along well too.  It was great.  The four of us will definately have to hang out more often.  Courtney's guy definately got my stamp of approval.  (though he's the luckier one of course ;o) )

Saturday was mine and Blake's anniversary.  He loved his shirt *grin*.  We had a lot of fun even though we ended up not really going anywhere.  We couldn't really come up with anything to go do.  So we pretty much stayed in and watched olympics.  (which have been awesome by the way)

Ok, now that I've insanely bored you all with my really long post about the past 2 1/2 weeks of my life... I will leave.  Sorry... kinda what happens when you haven't posted in a while *doh*

... I didn't mean for the explanation of that to be so long...

Today was awesome!!  Seriously... awesome.  

It started with me getting an hour later start than I wanted... But from there it was great.  I love driving in areas where most people I know don't know their way around real well... but I do... Its so much fun!  I just love knowing where I'm going really well in an area where I shouldn't cuz I've only been there a time or three.  Thats how I felt driving to McE today to buy tickets.  And then I drove from there to NC which was even cooler cuz I knew exactly where I was going without knowing where I was going.  WoooO!

So got to NC... Started with Patrick walking up to my car right when I was pulling in... Joined by David and Brad... And eventually Troy.  Possibly recruited two people for Tech Band...one of which is a drummer *yay* ... Watched Cascades practice... and man... I have a new favorite corps... well not favorite but added to list of favorites.  I liked them practicing... but I LOVED them when they performed...

I'm becoming ever more convinced that I should try out for a corps before I age out.  

Stopped by home... waited for Daddy who was finally convinced to go.  Started by seeing Scott, Anthony and Heather.  Then Kira and family... From there Anjali, my daddy and I sat with NC band.  It was great seeing everyone (though as the band went by I realized that there was hardly anyone in there I know)  Saw people from Milton and Sprayberry (including E :o) ) Went and sat with Courtney, Anjali, and a Zach that was supposed to stay with NC (shh! don't tell!)  When Crown showed up it didn't take long to spot my roomie.  We yelled her name and she turned and smiled really big... it was great!!  They were great.  Cavi's were of course great.  Blue Scouts were cool... Cascades were awesome!!

So yeah.  That was my day. 

Oo and on another great note... big possibility of me and Courtney going on a road trip to see a show... possibly two if she likes and my parents like my idea that I came up with... might mean me missing the end of band camp show... but I'll survive... Oh... one last thing.  Scotts moving!!  He's going to Oregon to go back to school... he can't leave Quest... Thats just so weird...

Ok I think I'm really done this time

Warning: Long post
     So this is basically gonna be my attempt at summing up the past week.  Wish me luck.

1/2 the Political, All the Party  (An add for C2... not to be confused with C^2, who is an awesome person, not a drink...)
    Random interesting Slogan that I saw... was amused and wante to post it, but after a week, Im not really sure of the point.

Eat Brie.  French Kiss (Eclipse gum add)
     Same as the coke add... but whatever

"Do not lie with a man as one lies with a woman.  that is detestable"  ~  A billboard in Charleston that I saw way too many times.  It pissed me off the more I saw it, but then I saw another billboard that made me feel better.  I don't remember exactly what it said anymore, but it was something a long the lines of constitution and equality and equal rights, that both gay and straight people deserve protection by the law... Well any way it wasn't anti-gay so it made me feel better.

Welcome to Moes :amount of times my dad said that when we passed a Moe's .... too damn many... Pretty much because we passed too damn many.  When returning a video to Blockbuster, there was an ambulance outside of it.  To this I proved my Point "Moe's:  Show up in your car, leave in an ambulance"

Be Kind Rewind
     Watched a good deal of movies.  Mystic River was pretty good, but sad.  Cold Mountain...which I didn't want to see in the first place... was pretty good up until the end.  Had to end that way though I guess... Random horror movies.  Wanted to see Welcome to Mooseport (which was on a blue video cassette?!) but the raging storm yesterday killed my aunts vcr... which made us have to go out to buy a new one for her today.  That and a new answering machine.  I miss my aunt already :o(

"Mr Sandman, bring me a dream"
     I've finally decided that I must get the Comic book series Sandman by Neil Gaiman.  I swear, this guy is the most awesome person ever.  Went to Barnes & Noble... They had all of them except for... NUMBER 1!!!  ... *shakes head in disbelief*  Picked up some cute single comic book stories by him though.  Murder Mysteries looks great.  I started reading one short story a night from Smoke and Mirrors, and I'm so in love with that book.  

Ok I don't remember what other things I was going to use.

The beach was awesome.  I only went twice but it was worth it.  If I hadn't gotten burned the first day (and...something else)  then we probably would have gotten back 1 or 2 more times.  (I got burned on the back of my legs and on my back... me!  I don't burn at all... maybe a little in the cheeks but thats all!... it was very weird, and very painful)  I wish Florida's beach had been like that when I was there.  The water may not have been as clear... but I wouldn't give up those waves for anything.

Fourth of July was great... we actually went out and watched fireworks!  And it wasn't even by my suggestion!!!  For like, 4 of the past 5 years, I couldn't get anyone to go see fireworks while we were on vacation, but this year my parents wanted to...We had the perfect spot too.  This one bridge... where before the fireworks for that river started, you could see them everywhere in the distance.  Then there was lightning too.  And fireworks over water are the best.  Theres nothing like watching the water change colors with the fireworks.  Even better:  a little bit before they started there were 2 or 3 baby dolphins that went under the bridge.  Its been a long time since I've seen dolphins.

Aesome storm yesterday... but I'm a freak so... yeah

If anyone knows of a '86 Thunderbird hubcap laying around, let me know.

I can say this, I love my Aunt and I wished so much taht I didn't have to leave.  I really didn't want to come back, as much as I missed my friends.  I see her for one week each year... which is nowhere near enough.  And Charleston is just such a great place.  

on another hand, i think somethings wrong with me... and its very weird.  I think I'm imagining things, and it is that time of year when I get this way, but I was hoping I wouldn't have to go through it.  It'll get better though.  August just needs to get here quicker... on the other hand, i don't want it to come quickly because I want to have more time with my friends... oh well, we'll see.

sorry this is so long guys...

I didn't even get to see Crown rehearse because we got there at their lunch break... and I was with Rachie so...I couldn't make her stay ;op.   I got to see Angela though!  (future roomie)  I didn't realize she made it...I only knew she was trying out.  

Despite missing out on some dciness... My friday was pretty awesome.  Got to see David, Larry, Terrace, Anna, Williams, Johnson (with facial hair *gasp*), Signe... some various other people I kinda knew... and a bunch of people I've never seen before in my life. Had tacos for dinner last night... Its amazing how good those tacos are and that I can't find tacos anywhere near as good anywhere else.  My parents should open up a restaurant.
